message: Bob, I'm offering you my product for $14,000. It's a great deal considering its value to you. Let me know what you think!
I appreciate your offer, but I was thinking more along the lines of $12,000. Is that something you'd be willing to consider?

Bob, I understand you're looking for a good deal, but $12,000 is simply too low for me.  How about we split the difference and go with $13,000? It's still a great price for you, and a fair compromise for me. What do you say?
I appreciate your willingness to compromise, but I'm still a bit below my target. Would you be willing to meet me at $11,500?

Bob, I see we're getting closer. While $11,500 is still below my minimum, I'm willing to go down to $12,500. This is a fair price considering the value to you, and I'm hoping we can reach an agreement. Let me know your thoughts.
I appreciate your flexibility, but I'm still trying to get a good deal. Would you be willing to meet me at $11,000?

Bob, we've been going back and forth, and I'm starting to think we might not be able to agree on a price. I'm willing to meet you halfway one last time at $11,750.  If you're not willing to budge, I'll have to move on to other buyers.
I appreciate your persistence, but I'm still trying to get a good deal. Would you be willing to meet me at $10,500?
